intro: Ternstroemia fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered ternstroemia, is a flowering plant species native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Theaceae, which includes camellias and other ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
